Body: I am currently writing an essay in linguistic typology on possessives. I got stuck in the last part, in which I am supposed to present a syntactic approach to the structure of possessives. I should find an example in the literature and simply present the approach in 300 words and draw an example tree... I've found an approach that words with predicate-movement, but the article is quite difficult to understand, so if anybody knows a different approach to the topic, I would very glad to hear about it...
Title: A syntactic approach to possessives
